cab.content: - 301I J f if-(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY*S GOVERNMENT) *SECRET, CAB IN ET.CP.3565. IRAQ AND TURKEY.Paraphrase of Telegram from High Commissioner of Iraq to the Secretary of State for the Colonies elated 13thDecember 1921.(Circulated by the Seoretary of State for the Colonies).Feisal states that no negotiations are being carried on by him with Kemalists and he fully realises that His Majesty's Government io averse from his entering into ^b&latlons with them. A letter has f however", recently been sent to him by his cousin Sherif Jamil at Amman suggesting that a certain Naji Bey who haa a high position with Mustafa Kamal should be approached. Naji Bey who Is related to Felsal1^ mother by marriage is^ Peisal sayssV a trusty Hed;]aa friend of his own and a soldier of some repute. If thoro Is no objection he would like to write to him and ascertain privately what are Mustafa Kamal's intentions regarding Iraq. I would be glad If you would inform me by telegram * ether His Majesty's Government has objection to Peisal's proposal. In my opinion this opportunity of obtaining reliable information should not be missed. Ttila refers to my telegram No, 7S6 of December 6th,(SD) COX.
